publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2514 Chris Ballance: Good Food for Primary School Pupils—That the Parliament commends East Ayrshire Council’s Catering Manager, Robin Gourlay, for deciding to pilot the Soil Association’s Food for Life targets in Hurlford Primary School; congratulates the Headteacher, Kirsteen McCartney, and school cook, Margaret Paterson, in meeting and exceeding the Food for Life targets of 30% organic and 50% locally-sourced ingredients and 75% unprocessed food in school meals; further recognises that fresh, local and organic food is the best way to deliver the nutrition our children need, and believes that all schools in Scotland should be encouraged to adopt Food for Life targets in keeping with the broad thrust of the Scottish Executive’s Hungry for Success strategy.

S2M-2514 Good Food for Primary School Pupils (lodged on 2 March 2005) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Brian Adam*, Eleanor Scott*, Robert Brown*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Robin Harper*, Mark Ballard*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Tommy Sheridan*
